abstract: Berkshire has owned an 80.1 percent share of Wesco, which focuses on insurance but includes other businesses, since 1983.
snippet: Berkshire has owned an 80.1 percent share of Wesco, which focuses on insurance but includes other businesses, since 1983.
lead_paragraph: Berkshire Hathaway, the holding company led by Warren E. Buffett, has agreed to buy the remaining shares of Wesco Financial Corporation, one of its largest subsidiaries, for $547.6 million in stock and cash, the companies announced Monday.

headline.main: Berkshire to Pay $548 Million for Rest of Wesco
